name: Remove parts from navigation, menu toolbar
description:
This style removes some of the unnecessary stuff in the address bar and hides/combines address bar buttons when not in use, and leaves you with more usable space to see and type web addresses, and add tabs, as well as for browsing

First, a summary of what this style actually does:
*Combines the stop and reload buttons
*Hides back and  forward buttons when unnecessary
*Removes the go, identity, star, and feed buttons
*Hides sub-menus
additional_info:
Unrelated to the style, but here are some other things I've done to get more space (to arrive at the screenshot you see here):
*Customize toolbars to move the back, forward, stop, and reload buttons to the tab bar (ensure that tab bar is always visible)
*Customize toolbars to move the address bar to the tab bar (Since your search bar will be no longer visible, you should set up search shortcuts, such as g for Google)
*Customize toolbars to hide menu, navigation, bookmarks, and status toolbars
*Install the Movable Firefox Button add-on to cut the width of the Firefox button in half
